column5: Well after reading the responses and a lot of help from so many of you we have decided to try to set up a little "small scale" B&B. I am not going to create a web site or anything, nor am I going to advertise in the local papers. We really don't want to own and operate a "business".  Our goal is going to be to try to focus on creating an opportunity for couples or small families to go somewhere clean, comfortable and affordable and have an opportunity to get out, enjoy the winter and/or do some ice fishing. It would be nice if we could just afford to give it away but we can't!  I have posted an add in the classifieds section in the "member business directory". It is pretty basic but if you would be kind enough to take a look at it and see if I have missed anything or need to clarify anything, I'd appreciate it.  Oh, and I promise I will not use the "general discussion" form again to promote this but without all your help it probably wouldn't have happened.  Thanks!  Cliff

Morning Cliff! I just looked at the ad. All seems fine but....it's really a little on the inexpensive side. J and I have been to your house and it's really a special place. If I am able to book with you this winter, I will not be taking the breakfast option...I've seen how you guys cook and I'd feel like I was robbing you at that price. Le B&B Chez le Gros Clifford & son Amour Suzanne. Really a nice ring to it!  I wish you both all the good fortune in the world and I KNOW you'll be getting lotsa people there this upcoming season.
Cliff, I keep in contact with a few of my old clients from the States who still fish the area.  I will keep your BB in mind.  Gook luck!  Phil
What an exciting opportunity Cliff, I hope it works well for you!  Good luck  Paul and I will definately have to make that one of our stops this year.  Joey
Wishing you all the best in your endeavour Cliff and Sue. It's sounds like an wondeful opportunity for both of you and for those who will be fortunate enough to spend time in your piece of paradise.
Good luck Cliff! what a good idea.

Well like Roy said,pretty much on the low side. All that breakfast and great company to boot. Best of luck to both you and Sue.  Cliff,do you think there will be ice?  Got your PM,we,ll be talk,n soon.
VERY cool...going over to check your posting in the other section now....then getting my ice gear all shined up
I'm thinkin maybe just sell and move into Cliff's basement..  Dock for the plane even...

Hey Cliff, you guys have it all set up. Gus and I are hoping since we didn't get the chance to get over to see you guys this year and with the new regs for ice fishing that we can make a couple of visits your way in the new year. Hope to see you soon.

Sounds like a nice place to visit and enjoy......is your Lake experiencing a new open season during the winter? Has it been open in the past (many years ago?).....What can you expect to catch?.....pickeral and perch I hope!......might be a nice diversion away from Scugog for a weekend....always enjoy new experiences and meeting new people (that may become freinds).

Here's wishing you both the very, very best my friend. You have the right place and of course the best hospitality. I'm with Roy, maybe a little light on the per person rate especially the way I have seen some of these OFC'rs eat!

Pickerel will still be closed in the Kawarthas (except Scugog) until mid May 2010...  Only panfish will be open for icefishing (perch, crappie, sunfish and bluegills) and all coarse fish (carp, suckers, rockbass, catfish and pike)...  Make sure you read and understand the new regulations regarding species, possession limits and size limits...
Word of mouth will be your best advertising Cliff...  Here's to success!!!...Cheers !!!
After you have done the ice thing Cliff,have you thought about a fall hunt package
sounds like an awesome opportunity !
He knows the deer carcass is too heavy to hang from the shower curtain rod whilst bleeding out.  JF

I know for sure I could send a few good people your way if that's the case Cliff. If that's an option, let me know, and I'll send out the refferals. You put them up for the night, I'll get them on some birds. I've been sending them to local motels.......your place would be absolutley perfect!!  S.
Cripes !!!...If you're not careful Cliff...you may be able to retire again...
Good luck Cliff!!  Im sure youll get alot of people through the door, just by word of mouth.
I'm certain this venture will be a big success Cliff. You aren't one for half measures.
I was thinking more along the lines of sitting in his stand Shane.  But birds sound good too.
